You may want to clean up or delete the persistent volumes and start the container from scratch after switching file sharing mode.

issue.title: Lots of "INFO reaped unknown pid " in log
issue.body:
I just upgraded my docker-gitlab to version `12.5.2`. And I found a lot of `INFO reaped unknown pid <pid-number>` messages in the log of gitlab.

```
2019-12-25 03:18:24,637 INFO reaped unknown pid 44831
2019-12-25 03:18:27,127 INFO reaped unknown pid 44863
2019-12-25 03:18:29,721 INFO reaped unknown pid 44876
2019-12-25 03:18:30,251 INFO reaped unknown pid 44889
2019-12-25 03:18:32,941 INFO reaped unknown pid 44902
...
```


The messages are found by running `docker logs -f <docker-gitlab-container-id>`.

Does anyone know if this is a normal phenomenon or not?

comment.body:
I have upgraded to 13.12.4 and tried the @vizee solution, still having the same logs when I try to make a pull or a push:

`INFO reaped unknown pid `

And

`Permission denied (publickey)`

issue.title: Added missing configuration variable OAUTH_ALLOW_BYPASS_TWO_FACTOR.
issue.body:
This variable is important due to the fact that two authenticators are already enabled within the provider. 

Without this variable, it will prompt the user for two-factor authentication twice if GitLab enforces 2FA.

comment.body: Thank you @kkimurak, it is indeed better, it give more flexbility

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -918,7 +918,7 @@ production: &base
     # This option should only be configured for providers which already have two factor.
     # This configration dose not apply to SAML.
     # (default: false)
-    allow_bypass_two_factor: null
+    allow_bypass_two_factor: [{{OAUTH_ALLOW_BYPASS_TWO_FACTOR}}]
comment.body:
The comment above this line explains that you can set this to true/false to specify "allow all"/"disallow all." I think it would be good to remove the surrounding square brackets so that the user can set values ​​other than the array.

```suggestion
    allow_bypass_two_factor: {{OAUTH_ALLOW_BYPASS_TWO_FACTOR}}
```

pull_request.body:
This variable is important due to the fact that two authenticators are already enabled within the provider. 

Without this variable, it will prompt the user for two-factor authentication twice if GitLab enforces 2FA.

review.body:
Thank you for your contribution.  
I have a comment about surrounding square brackets in gitlab.yml. Feel free to ignore me if you beleive no one want to set `true` (allow all) or `false` (allow none)

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -2023,6 +2023,10 @@ Allow users with existing accounts to login and auto link their account via the
 
 Comma separated list if oauth providers to disallow access to `internal` projects. Users creating accounts via these providers will have access internal projects. Accepted values are `cas3`, `github`, `bitbucket`, `gitlab`, `google_oauth2`, `facebook`, `twitter`, `saml`, `crowd`, `auth0` and `azure_oauth2`. No default.
 
+##### `OAUTH_ALLOW_BYPASS_TWO_FACTOR`
+
+Comma separated list of oauth providers where users can sign in without using two-factor authentication (2FA). Defaults to `[]`.
comment.body:
If you agree to remove surrounding square brackets, this line also need to be updated.  
I'm not sure what happen if we set the default value to `[]` but I believe it works as expect (equivalent to setting `false`?)

```suggestion
Specify oauth providers where users can sign in without using two-factor authentication (2FA). You can define this using an array of providers like `["twitter", "google_oauth2"]`. Setting this to `true` or `false` applies to all - allow all or none. Defaults to `false`.
```

issue.title: OAuth2 - Scope Configuration & label
issue.body: Hi, I'm trying to configure the OAuth 2 Generic provider for Azure B2C. I used those variables to configure everything : As an example this code has been tested with Keycloak, with the following variables: OAUTH2_GENERIC_APP_ID, OAUTH2_GENERIC_APP_SECRET, OAUTH2_GENERIC_CLIENT_SITE, OAUTH2_GENERIC_CLIENT_USER_INFO_URL, OAUTH2_GENERIC_CLIENT_AUTHORIZE_URL, OAUTH2_GENERIC_CLIENT_TOKEN_URL, OAUTH2_GENERIC_CLIENT_END_SESSION_ENDPOINT, OAUTH2_GENERIC_ID_PATH, OAUTH2_GENERIC_USER_UID, OAUTH2_GENERIC_USER_NAME, OAUTH2_GENERIC_USER_EMAIL, OAUTH2_GENERIC_NAME, There are two fields that i'm not able to configure 1) The label (How can I configure the button label?) I tried OAUTH2_GENERIC_LABEL but no success. 2) I need to add an application id in the scope but I'm not able to define the scope. I tried OAUTH2_GENERIC_SCOPE but still no success. Thank you for help,

issue.title: Add build patch to avoid removing node_modules
issue.body:
note: Only user who use relative_url will be affected on runtime

`gitlab/script/frontent/preinstall.mjs` is introduced since v16.4.0. This script is executed on compiling assets : for `sameersbn/gitlab` this is on build, and on container startup if using the relative url. This script removes `NODE_MODULES` (/home/git/gitlab/node_modules) when "the folder seems to end up being a corrupted somehow"  
See more detail: [gitlab-org/gitlab!130938](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/130938)

On sameersbn/gitlab, the folder node_modules is declared as volume. The volume is always busy so that cannot be removed in the container. You can see following error reported on container startup (sameersbn/gitlab:16.4.0 or later).

````
yarn install v1.22.19
$ node ./scripts/frontend/preinstall.mjs
[WARNING] package.json changed significantly. Removing node_modules to be sure there are no problems. node:internal/process/esm_loader:97
    internalBinding('errors').triggerUncaughtException(
                              ^

[Error: EBUSY: resource busy or locked, rmdir '/home/git/gitlab/node_modules'] {
  errno: -16,
  code: 'EBUSY',
  syscall: 'rmdir',
  path: '/home/git/gitlab/node_modules'
}

Node.js v18.17.1
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/install for documentation about this command. -----
````

This PR add a build time patch to change the behavior of script/frontend/preinstall.mjs to not to remove node_modules directly, but empty it instead.

comment.body: ok please let me know if you need anything to help me understand this patch. I appreciate your efforts to keep up with regular releases.

release.body:
## Docker Images for sameersbn/gitlab:16.5.0

- [docker.io](https://hub.docker.com/r/sameersbn/gitlab/tags)
- [quay.io](https://quay.io/repository/sameersbn/gitlab?tag=16.5.0&tab=tags)

## Installation

For installation and usage instructions please refer to the [README](https://github.com/sameersbn/docker-gitlab/blob/16.5.0/README.md)

## Important notes

Please note that this version does not yet include any rework as a consequence of the major release and possibly some functions in our implementation might not be usable yet or only to a limited extent.

Don't forget to consider the version specific upgrading instructions for [GitLab CE](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/update/) **before** upgrading your GitLab CE instance!

**GitLab 16.0 requires at least PostgreSQL 13.**

You are kindly invited to provide contributions.

## Contributing

If you find this image useful here's how you can help:

- Send a Pull Request with your awesome new features and bug fixes
- Be a part of the community and help resolve [issues](https://github.com/sameersbn/docker-gitlab/issues)
- Support the development of this image with a [donation](http://www.damagehead.com/donate/)

## Changelog

- [43d0a969] Upgrade to GitLab CE 16.5.0 (Steven Achilles)
- [a2dd4e5e] Accept multiple hosts for RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST (Kazunori Kimura)
- [755a9ac8] Update docs/keycloak-idp.md (massej)
- [8bcb068c] Update README.md (massej)
- [964e29c9] Fix tipo. (massej)
- [ab0e2e63] Update docker-compose.yml (massej)
- [fa75409a] Update README.md (massej)
- [a903d982] Update functions (massej)
- [af693c5e] Update env-defaults (massej)
- [c8bc43b9] Added missing label and scope variable field. (massej)
- [7a49de87] Add missing trailing backslash (sam-mosleh)
- [af9e984f] Mount /tmp/builds from host to runners (Sam Mosleh)

  • quay.io

Please note that this version does not …

issue.title: Add build patch to avoid removing node_modules
issue.body:
note: Only user who use relative_url will be affected on runtime

`gitlab/script/frontent/preinstall.mjs` is introduced since v16.4.0. This script is executed on compiling assets : for `sameersbn/gitlab` this is on build, and on container startup if using the relative url. This script removes `NODE_MODULES` (/home/git/gitlab/node_modules) when "the folder seems to end up being a corrupted somehow"  
See more detail: [gitlab-org/gitlab!130938](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/130938)

On sameersbn/gitlab, the folder node_modules is declared as volume. The volume is always busy so that cannot be removed in the container. You can see following error reported on container startup (sameersbn/gitlab:16.4.0 or later).

````
yarn install v1.22.19
$ node ./scripts/frontend/preinstall.mjs
[WARNING] package.json changed significantly. Removing node_modules to be sure there are no problems. node:internal/process/esm_loader:97
    internalBinding('errors').triggerUncaughtException(
                              ^

[Error: EBUSY: resource busy or locked, rmdir '/home/git/gitlab/node_modules'] {
  errno: -16,
  code: 'EBUSY',
  syscall: 'rmdir',
  path: '/home/git/gitlab/node_modules'
}

Node.js v18.17.1
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/install for documentation about this command. -----
````

This PR add a build time patch to change the behavior of script/frontend/preinstall.mjs to not to remove node_modules directly, but empty it instead.

pull_request.title: Mount builds folder to runners
pull_request.body:
In many situations, Docker runners must mount the builds folder to continue with a job, but this is not currently possible due to runner configurations. It is preferable to spare new users from any inconveniences since your repository is widely used.

References:
https://docs.gitlab.com/runner/register/#one-line-registration-command
https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/testing/code_quality.html#improve-code-quality-performance-with-private-runners

issue.title: RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST  incorrect string
issue.body:
Hello,
I have problem in add host in whiteList RACK ATTACK

i try add in whitelist more then one IP. 
as example:
in **docker-compose.yml**
`RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST="1.1.1.1,192.168.0.0/24"`

after start containers i view in  **/home/git/gitlab/config/gitlab.yml** 
`ip_whitelist:  ["1.1.1.1,192.168.0.0/24"]`
its not a Ruby array its only one string value in array

By [ Official manual](https://docs.gitlab.com/omnibus/settings/configuration.html#configure-a-failed-authentication-ban) 
_ip_whitelist: IPs to not block. They must be formatted as strings in a Ruby array. CIDR notation is supported in GitLab 12.1 and later. For example, ["127.0.0.1", "127.0.0.2", "127.0.0.3", "192.168.0.1/24"]._
its not equal  ["1.1.1.1,192.168.0.0/24"]

in repository on file  **docker-gitlab/assets/runtime/config/gitlabhq/gitlab.yml**
i view      
`ip_whitelist: ["{{RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST}}"]`
As its not correct


IMHO better change  to  
ip_whitelist: {{RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST}}
and in **docker-compose.yml** write as RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST= '["1.1.1.1","192.168.0.0/24"]'

and replace in **docker-gitlab/assets/runtime/env-defaults**
RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST=${RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST:-"127.0.0.1"}  to RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST=${RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST:-["127.0.0.1"]}

And add in manual example for multi IP  value

commits.message:
Accept multiple hosts for RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST

see sameersbn/docker-gitlab#2828

The current setup also accepts multiple hosts,
but the syntax is a bit strange.
The leading/trailing double quotes are embedded
in the configuration file itself,
so users should expect double quotes around the string they set.
In other words, when setting two hosts 0.0.0.0 and 1.1.1.1,
you will set the strings 0.0.0.0","1.1.1.1 in the
environment variables. This is not intuitive.

This commit removes double quote around corresponding config
and set backward compatibility fallback process
to surround whole with [], each host with double quote.
Also, validation script (written in ruby) will be executed during configuration.

Example docker-compose.yml
````yaml
services:
  gitlab:
    image: sameersbn/gitlab:latest
    environment:
    - RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST='["127.0.0.1","0.0.0.0"]'
````

Co-authored-by: Mikhail Khadarenka <chodorenko@mail.ru>

Merge pull request #2846 from kkimurak/issue/2828-allow-multiple-value-for-rack-attack-whitelist

Accept multiple hosts for RACK_ATTACK_WHITELIST
